Ad Text:
Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for accuracy and system integrity? Join our team in Eveleigh and play a key role in maintaining and optimising our Asset Management System (AMS).

What you'll do:

Ensure data integrity and accuracy in the AMS
Perform data updates, reconciliations, and reporting (Oracle & ArcGIS)
Provide user support, training, and help desk assistance
Extract and deliver spatial and aspatial data
Investigate and resolve data quality issues
Collaborate within a small, dynamic team and support outsourced AMS services
What you'll bring:

Tertiary qualifications in IT, Business, or a related discipline
Proven experience in spatial data management and asset data systems
Strong attention to detail, analytical mindset, and a proactive approach
If you're ready to make an impact in a role that blends data integrity, technology, and collaboration, we'd love to hear from you.

A global, digitally enabled business that empowers a brighter future by connecting millions of people with their assets – safely, securely and responsibly. Through our two businesses MUFG Retirement Solutions and MUFG Corporate Markets, we partner with a diversified portfolio of global clients to provide robust, efficient and scalable services, purpose-built solutions and modern technology platforms that deliver world class outcomes and experiences. A member of MUFG, a global financial group, we help manage regulatory complexity, improve data management and connect people with their assets, through exceptional user experience that leverages the expertise of our people combined with scalable technology, digital connectivity and data insights.

Lead the AI-driven transformation of MUFG Corporate Markets.

MUFG Corporate Markets is part of MUFG Pension & Market Services (MPMS), and we are accelerating a major transformation agenda. We’re reimagining how we operate, serve clients, and unlock value through automation, digitisation, and AI.

We are seeking a visionary Director of AI, Automation & Data to lead this transformation — embedding AI as a trusted capability that enhances operational efficiency, elevates client experience, and ensures responsible, compliant data use.

Your mission

• Transform operational processes — reducing manual effort and delivering measurable cost efficiencies
• Build enterprise-wide AI and automation capabilities from the ground up — intelligent workflows, self-service solutions, and conversational AI
• Ensure alignment to regulatory, ethical, and organisational standards
• Partner with leaders globally to drive commercial and client outcomes
• Lead and inspire a multi-disciplinary team across transformation, data & analytics, and AI

What you’ll lead

• Development and execution of the enterprise AI and automation strategy
• A modern AI operating model, including governance, demand intake, and change enablement
• Data governance and platform uplift to support analytics maturity across markets
• Call centre modernisation — introducing voice and chat AI to enhance client experience and reduce wait times
• Digitisation of paper-based processes — creating intuitive, conversational journeys
• External representation in industry, vendor, and regulatory forums

What you’ll bring

• 10+ years’ leadership experience in AI, automation, data, or large-scale transformation
• Proven track record modernising legacy environments in regulated sectors
• Deep expertise in data governance, privacy, risk, and ethical AI practices
• Strong executive presence — able to influence senior stakeholders and drive adoption at scale
• A balance of enterprise credibility and startup-style agility
• Experience leading diverse technical teams and attracting top talent

You are a strategic thinker who is also execution-focused — thriving in complexity, navigating ambiguity, and bringing teams along on the journey.

Why join us?

Join a global financial institution where innovation is supported, celebrated, and empowered. MPMS fosters a culture of flexibility, inclusivity, wellbeing, and continuous learning.

Benefits include:
• Hybrid working model
• Salary sacrifice via superannuation
• Paid parental leave
• Wellbeing & Volunteer leave
• Health insurance discounts
• Career pathways and professional development support.

This is a rare opportunity to define the future of intelligent operations at MUFG Corporate Markets. If you’re ready to shape the next era of AI-driven transformation and build a capability that will scale globally — we’d love to hear from you.

Category:
Water & Waste Engineering (Engineering)
Government - Local (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
About the team

The Strategic Asset Management team provides expert advice to manager and colleagues on best practice asset management practice. We undertake analysis in GIS and using Power Bi, trial innovative approaches and use AI if practical. In this team you may work with all assets including water supply, sewerage or stormwater drainage, although most often analyse drainage assets.

About your new role

As the City’s Stormwater Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining Stormwater infrastructure to ensure effective drainage, flood mitigation and environmental protection. You will play a pivotal role in planning, assessing and improving our stormwater systems.
In your day to day you will use our key systems such as SAP, ArcGIS & Power Bi, and liaise with teams across Council to collaboratively develop our asset management approach. You may also lead innovative projects involving advanced analytics, machine learning and AI recognition. 
Key responsibilities:
•    Provide technical advice and support to planning, development, and operations teams.
•    Contribute to the development and review of engineering standards and guidelines
•    Ensure stormwater assets comply with relevant legislation, environmental standards, and council policies.
•    Undertake detailed analysis of asset and maintenance data, and other datasets, using Power Bi, GIS, Excel, SAP and other tools available to the team.
•    Analyse asset performance data to identify risks, failures, or maintenance needs.
•    Develop and implement asset management strategies for stormwater infrastructure.

We're looking for people who have:

•    Bachelor degree of Engineering or equivalent 
•    Bachelors degree of Asset management
•    Experience using Power Bi coding (using DAX) and ArcGIS Model Builder is desirable
•    Experience in local government or the water industry is highly regarded
•    Experience using Python or other computer programming languages would be desirable

Be part of shaping the Gold Coast's future

The Gold Coast is inspired by lifestyle and driven by opportunity. We are the second largest Council in Australia.

We care about being the most flexible government organisation in Australia and we have a range of benefits to help you create the right balance:

9-day fortnight

Flexible work arrangements to suit your lifestyle, including hybrid/work from home options, flexible working hours and locations

Personal and professional development courses

Access to 350+ fitness facilities through Fitness Passport

4 free confidential counselling sessions a year for you or an immediate family member

1 free nutritionist and financial advice session per year

We pride ourselves on our shared mission of being a high-performing, customer-focused organisation which delivers value-for-money services to the community. We're committed to creating a diverse workplace and inclusive culture.

How to apply

For more information, view the position brief by clicking the paperclip icon in the topright corner of this screen.

Click 'Apply' to submit your online application. Upload your Resume with a Cover Letter (of no more than 2 pages) outlining how your skills, experience and personal attributes would allow you to achieve success in this role.

Documents needs to be less than 2MB in size and PDF format is preferred. If you encounter technical issues when applying, please email recruitment@goldcoast.qld.gov.au

Our selection process may include a one-way video interview via Criteria, a face-to-face or virtual interview via Microsoft Teams, reference checks via Xref and additional checks including police checks, employment history checks, qualification checks, pre-employment medical reviews and drug and alcohol testing.

Contact Person

Rhys McQueen

Contact Number

07 5582 8384

Closing Date

Monday, 10th November 2025

Please note applications for all of our vacancies close at 10.00pm on the listed closing date.

The City of Gold Coast is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are committed to supporting an environment where all employees, regardless of their differences or similarities, feel valued, respected and supported. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander persons are encouraged to apply.

Job Title: Cloud & AI Applications Solution Engineer - Melbourne
Ad Text:
Overview

This position is intended for recent graduates who completed/will complete their Bachelor's or Master's degree between 2023 -2025.

As an AI Applications Solution Engineer, you’ll work side-by-side with customers and partners to design and deploy secure, scalable, AI-powered solutions. You’ll engage in hands-on activities such as proof of concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops, while providing trusted technical guidance on the use of Azure AI, AI Foundry, Responsible AI, and Microsoft’s cloud platform.

We believe those just beginning their journey bring a crucial perspective to advance our mission of empowering customers and partners through AI transformation. The MCAPS Early in Profession (EiP) program prepares the next generation of leaders to be the workforce of the future.

A curated onboarding, skilling, community and career development journey promotes professional dexterity, so participants are prepared—and qualified — to quickly deliver customer and partner impact. This journey includes a strong emphasis on developing technical skills and product knowledge, ensuring that participants are equipped with the necessary competencies to meet the demands of their roles.

A blend of AI and human-powered experiences in their first three years provide the skills and practice participants need to thrive in their careers and get farther, faster. 

This is a unique opportunity to accelerate your career, deepen your technical expertise, and shape the future of AI applications. Join a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning, while making a meaningful impact with customers across Australia

Qualifications

Required/minimum qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field OR 1+ year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR equivalent experience.

Additional or preferred qualifications

2+ years technical pre-sales or technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience.

1+ year(s) experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management.

Responsibilities

Solution Design and Proof of Concept

Contributes to demonstrations (e.g., proof of concept [POC] sessions) of solutions based on specific Microsoft products through initial engagements and coaching from senior colleagues.

Leverages partner/customer teams as needed to prove product capabilities and integration into customer environment.

Builds own awareness of digital transformation sales methodologies.

Presents reference architectures to partners or customers for key parts of their technology sets.

Build Strategy

Reviews customer interactions and raises competitive information to account teams to contribute to development and landing of compete strategies.

Contributes to product strategy by soliciting and communicating customer feedback.

Tailors Microsoft standard messaging to audience using knowledge of specific Microsoft products.

Education

Promotes readiness to internal teams.

Consumes and leverages readiness materials to expand domain knowledge and practices expertise by communicating with customers, partners, and senior colleagues.

Participates as a member in the Microsoft tech community, attends community calls, sessions, hackathons, etc., and acts as a resource for their technology area.

Leverage Partner Ecosystem

Builds awareness of partner technical capacity through observation.

Engages in partner sell-with scenarios by contributing to the facilitation of technical engagements and partnering with colleagues to manage the sales process.

Scale Customer Engagements

Develops understanding of current customer context and anticipates next steps. Uses product expertise to build credibility with customers.

Engages other resources, leveraging basic resource knowledge, for key areas of technology as needed to overcome technical blockers on assigned technology set.

Engages with and reaches out to customers with coaching from others.

Drives technical wins or portions of technical wins with support from peers. Improves customer interactions through feedback and observation.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Industry leading healthcare

Educational resources

Discounts on products and services

Savings and investments

Maternity and paternity leave

Generous time away

Giving programs

Opportunities to network and connect

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Overview

Are you insatiably curious, deeply passionate about the realm of databases and analytics, and ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment in the era of AI? If so, we invite you to join our team as Cloud & AI - Data Solution Engineer (SE) in Innovative Data Platform for SME&C - Small, Medium Enterprises and Channel business, here at Microsoft. Here, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, working on cutting-edge projects that leverage the latest technologies to drive meaningful impact. Join us and be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.

Databases & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products including IaaS and PaaS services on the Azure Platform in the age of AI. These technologies empower customers to build, deploy, and manage database and analytics applications in a cloud-native way.

Qualifications

Minimum required Qualifications 

Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 4+ years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience

OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 6+ years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience

OR 7+ years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience

OR equivalent experience.

4+ years experience on Azure Databases (SQL DB, Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL) from migration & modernize and creating new AI apps.

2+ years experience on Azure Analytics (Fabric, Azure Databricks, Purview) and competitors (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) in data warehouse, data lake, big data, analytics, real-time intelligent, and reporting using integrated Data Security & Governance.

4+ years experience leading technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.

Responsibilities

As an Innovative Cloud & AI - Data Solution Engineer (SE), you will play a pivotal role in helping our customers unlock the full potential of Microsoft’s cloud database and analytics stack across every stage of deployment. You’ll collaborate closely with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate the Fabric Data Platform, including Azure Databases and Analytics, through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, hone your technical skills, and become adept at solution design and deployment. You’ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate database and analytics migration into their deployment workflows. In summary, you’ll help customers modernize their data platform and realize the full value of Microsoft’s platform, all while enjoying flexible work opportunities.

As a trusted technical advisor, you’ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate database and analytics migration into their deployment workflows. In summary, you’ll help customers modernize their data platform and realize the full value of Microsoft’s platform.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Industry leading healthcare

Educational resources

Discounts on products and services

Savings and investments

Maternity and paternity leave

Generous time away

Giving programs

Opportunities to network and connect

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Job description


At BAE Systems Australia

Do interesting work that MATTERS
ENJOY what you do
GROW your career
Be YOU

We work in a thriving sector – one that puts us at the forefront of exciting and meaningful work. Every day we push boundaries to produce some of the world's most innovative and ground breaking technology. Individually we all contribute to our success. Collectively we make the impossible possible.

Recognised for delivering projects of global and national significance that help keep Australia safe, it is our shared passion that shapes our culture, and our people that make it a great place to work.

About the OPPORTUNITY

We have a great opportunity for a GNC Engineer to join our Autonomy Program based at Richmond – Victoria, reporting to the GNC Lead.

We embrace flexible work arrangements at BAE Systems Australia, such as working a 9-day fortnight and hybrid working.

You will be responsible for working with other members of the GNC Team, under direction and in support of the GNC Lead. They will also work with the other project design (software, hardware, mechanical, etc.) Engineers and support teams to ensure a system orientated, integrated approach to the project engineering development and verification activities.

Key responsibilities include:

Development of models and simulations of complex vehicles and systems using model-based design methodologies with MATLAB and Simulink
Liaise with the customer and supplier stakeholders in support of model development and validation
Define and execute tests and perform Monte Carlo analysis on control system products
Review technical work created by colleagues
Develop and document requirements and verification and validation activities for both models and control systems
Perform system engineering activities including requirements management, candidate solution development, system design, system analysis, integration, system tests, acceptance tests and certification
Undertake travel to domestic locations to support flight test and integration activities

The MQ-28 Ghost Bat is an affordable, semi-autonomous uncrewed air vehicle developed in partnership with Boeing. As part of the team, the successful applicant will support the GNC Lead and Engineering manager in the technical development of autonomous Guidance Navigation and Control solutions to optimise the operational capabilities of the MQ-28 uncrewed air vehicle.

About YOU

Experience with MATLAB & Simulink are considered to be essential
Applicant must have a demonstrated understanding of complex control systems OR experience in 6DOF modelling and simulation of flight vehicles
Applicant must be eligible to hold a Australian Government issued NV1 or higher security clearance and Eligibility to be cleared for International Traffic In Arms (ITAR) regulations
Experience working with flight control systems, UAVs, rockets, flight testing is considered desirable

We believe in hiring for potential, we know that some candidates hesitate if they don't tick all the boxes.  If this role interests you, but you don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply.

About US

You will be joining a workplace that truly cares about your wellbeing.

Our people are diverse and we value the variety of perspectives this brings, we know that a culture that is inclusive and fosters a sense of belonging is a place we can all make the most of our unique talents and be our best.

As Australia's largest defence company in a rapidly growing sector, you will be connected into a global team and encouraged to explore where your career might take you whether that is a traditional career path or squiggly one, there are infinite possibilities for you at BAE Systems Australia. 

BAE Systems recognises the sacrifices of those who have served our Nation and their families.  We support our veteran community through our internal veteran network (VetNet Australia) and strong charitable partnerships, internal offerings including reserve service leave, a Veteran Mentoring Program and other exclusive offerings available through our strategic partners.

We welcome applicants from all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, pregnancy, age, or other lived experience; and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all positions.

We are proud to be recognised as an employer of choice for women by WORK180.

Awarded the 2024 Quarter 1 Benchmarcx Triple R- Excellence In Candidate Experience Certification. As a member of the Circle Back Initiative we commit to respond to every applicant.

To learn more about our competitive employee benefits, flexibility, other employment opportunities and what to expect from our recruitment process please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

Clearances

As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and either possess or be eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearances. Further information regarding security clearances.

International Traffic In Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role. Please visit this webpage for more information.

We’re seeking a Computer Vision Developer on a 6-month contract to accelerate model development, edge deployment, and system integration. You’ll work directly with the founder and technical advisors to turn real-world venue data into a production-ready system.




What You’ll Do:

Develop and train deep learning models for behavioural and anomaly detection using video data.

Fine-tune pre-trained backbones (e.g. I3D, SlowFast, ViViT, YOLOv8-Pose) with real-world footage.

Deploy and optimise models for edge inference (NVIDIA Jetson / Coral TPU).

Build data pipelines: ingest RTSP streams → preprocess → infer → alert.

Design APIs and dashboards to log, visualise, and audit incidents.

Apply privacy-by-design principles (no facial recognition; anonymised logs).

Collaborate on pilot venue installations and system troubleshooting.

Maintain CI/CD and model-versioning pipelines for ongoing iteration.




Startup Operating Environment:

Off Tap Watch is a fast-moving startup — we operate on short, iterative build / test / deploy cycles.
You’ll be expected to:

Participate in regular stand-ups and progress reviews (Slack / video calls).

Provide concise technical reporting and demos of new features or model performance.

Rapidly test, deploy, and refine features based on real pilot data and feedback.

This role suits someone who thrives under tight feedback loops, values speed, and can deliver robust outcomes in evolving conditions.




You'll Bring:

Core Skills

Proven experience in Computer Vision / Machine Learning (Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, OpenCV).

Background in video action or anomaly detection.

Familiarity with datasets such as UCF-Crime, Hockey Fight, or UR Fall Detection.

Understanding of temporal modelling, object tracking, and pose estimation.

Experience deploying on edge devices or low-latency video systems.

Working knowledge of Docker, FastAPI/Flask, PostgreSQL/MongoDB, and basic frontend integration(React/Next.js preferred).

Awareness of Australian privacy and CCTV compliance requirements.

Bonus Skills

Experience with AWS Panorama, Azure Video Indexer, or GCP Vertex AI Edge.

Background in IoT / smart-camera pipelines.

Exposure to incident detection, retail analytics, or security AI systems.




Who You Are

Thrive in lean, agile startup environments.

Prioritise real-world outcomes over theoretical accuracy.

Communicate clearly with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Believe in building responsible, safety-enhancing AI.

Role Details 

Working as an Automation Engineer in our Smithfield Pulp and Paper mill, you’ll play a key role in optimizing system uptime and reliability. You’ll provide breakdown and call-out support, enhance control loop performance and drive minor modifications and improvements. Experience with DCS and paper machine systems is essential.

What you'll do 

Provide automation support across I/O blocks, DCS, QCS, PLC systems, and OSI PI Historian. 
Perform hands-on tasks in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment with a small engineering team. 
Manage and service automation systems with deep understanding of process and field equipment impact. 
Ensure accurate real-time data for decision-making and optimize equipment to support strategic goals. 

This plant operates on a 24/7-day basis and you will need to be flexible to work additional hours as required including being on our call-out roster.

What You Will Bring 

A highly motivated engineer with a proactive approach, enthusiasm for troubleshooting and take accountability for tasks, you will also have: 

Diploma in Engineering, Bachelor of Electrical Engineering, Process Chemical Engineering (or equivalent) 
3 years’ minimum experience within a continuous process environment (preferably within the Paper, Aluminum, Steel, Mining, FMCG, Heavy industries) 
At least 3 years' experience in electrical, instrument, and control system fields 
Distributed Control Systems (DCS)?and Programmable Control Logic (PLC) experience 
Experience with automation systems, server hardware, and supporting infrastructure 
Experience with maintaining computer operating systems, Oracle databases, and TCP/IP networking 
Virtualization knowledge and experience 

 

What you’ll love when you join us:

Sustainability: Contribute to sustainability initiatives that make a difference.? 
Supportive Environment: Be part of a team that values safety, respect, and collaboration.? 
Leave: Opportunity to purchase additional leave? 
Visy discounts: Take advantage of discounts with RSEA, Avis, Harvey Norman and other retailers.? 

 

About Visy? 

Visy is powering the circular economy, closing the loop between packaging, remanufacturing and recycling. As Australia’s leading recycled and kraft paper manufacturer, Visy Pulp and Paper is a big part of our business. Our integrated recycling and manufacturing operations means we collect paper and cardboard from households and businesses and turn it into up to 100% recycled paper. We are also home to the world’s most environmentally friendly kraft paper mill in Tumut, providing high-quality kraft paper for domestic and international markets. The paper we produce supplies our board facilities across Australia and New Zealand, where it is remanufactured into cardboard packaging for the food and beverage industry.? 

Ready to make a difference? Apply now and be a key player in shaping our future!?? 

Please contact Nicholas Strang on Nicholas.strang@visy.com for a confidential discussion or apply now.? 

You will be required to meet Visy’s employment criteria which will include a criminal history check and pre-employment medical (including drug & alcohol testing)?? 

Visy is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.? 

These roles are only open to candidates currently residing in Australia with full working rights.?

Solutions Architect Contract Opportunity | Enterprise Environment | Focus on Automation & Integration

We are seeking an experienced Automation Solutions Architect to join a large-scale internal program focused on uplifting IT automation capabilities. This role will play a key part in designing and delivering automation and integration solutions across a complex enterprise environment.

Role: Solution Architect 
Client: Rio Tinto
Duration: 03/11/2025 to 02/11/2026 - 12 Month Contract
Location: Brisbane CBD

Key Responsibilities
Develop current and future state architecture blueprints across a portfolio of 10 work packages.
Design monitoring tools and contribute to the introduction of an AI Ops MVP solution.
Create automation pattern designs and cross-platform automation patterns to support IT service delivery.
Build infrastructure cost models to estimate savings from decommissioning systems.
Submit designs to CAB/ARB and chair Design Authority reviews.
Collaborate with Cybersecurity, IDM, Networks, and other teams to resolve complex automation use cases.
Maintain documentation in SharePoint and contribute input to roadmap planning.
Participate in Agile ceremonies and work flexibly across time zones.
About You
Proven experience in automation architecture and integration, particularly with Azure.
Strong understanding of ServiceNow and IT process automation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to navigate complex, matrixed environments and manage diverse stakeholder groups.
Experience working in large enterprise environments with shifting priorities.
Comfortable contributing to strategy and roadmap discussions, while focusing on execution.
Please apply now or reach out to myself at chantelle.lee@peoplebank.com.au / 07 3291 5405 for a confidential chat. 


Peoplebank and Leaders IT are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone belongs. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need adjustments to the recruitment process due to your circumstances, please let us know—we’re here to support you.

We’re looking for a talented AI Platform Engineer to help design and build the core infrastructure that powers next-generation AI solutions. This role focuses on creating the scalable, automated, and secure platform that enables rapid experimentation, reliable deployment, and seamless integration of AI technologies across the business. You’ll be part of the team that turns AI ideas into production-ready systems—ensuring every solution operates efficiently, safely, and at scale.

Key Responsibilities
Deployment and automation

Design, build, and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI workloads using GitOps practices
Automate deployments and manage the full release lifecycle for AI and ML models
Cloud and infrastructure management

Manage containerised environments (Docker, Kubernetes) and optimise cloud resources for scale and cost
Develop systems for managing data pipelines, model artefacts, and versioning with proper governance
Internal platform enablement

Build modular frameworks, SDKs, templates, and self-service tools that empower teams to develop and deploy AI applications independently
Establish standards and automation that make AI delivery faster, safer, and more consistent
Monitoring, security, and compliance

Implement observability and model performance monitoring systems
Engineer compliance, security, and governance directly into pipelines, ensuring full auditability and responsible AI practices
Cross-platform integration

Design and maintain integrations that enable AI systems to work seamlessly across cloud and on-premise environments
About You
2–4 years of experience in MLOps, DevOps, or AI infrastructure engineering
Strong hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP, and Docker/Kubernetes
Proficient in Python or Bash scripting, with a solid grasp of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
Experience implementing GitOps methodologies for version-controlled, auditable environments
Skilled in building developer enablement tools such as SDKs, CLIs, or internal templates
Knowledge of data governance, security controls, and compliance in production systems
Exposure to LLM-based architectures (e.g. RAG, vector databases) and frameworks such as LangGraph, LangSmith, or Langfuse is advantageous
Collaborative mindset with strong problem-solving ability and curiosity for emerging AI technologies
Why You’ll Love Working Here
Flexible leave options including wellbeing, birthday, and volunteer days
Hybrid and pet-friendly environment with on-site parking
Professional development support including study leave and LinkedIn Learning access
Recognition programs, incentive pay, and wellbeing initiatives

Job Title: AI Engineer - Applied AI and LLM Solutions
Ad Text:
About the Role Are you passionate about using AI to solve real business problems and create meaningful impact? We’re looking for an AI Engineer who can bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI capabilities and practical, scalable solutions that transform the way people work and interact.
You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organisation to design, prototype, and deploy AI applications that make workflows smarter, decisions faster, and experiences better. This is a hands-on role where you’ll see your work directly improve efficiency and outcomes.

What You’ll Do
Design and build AI solutions using LLMs, RAG architectures, OCR, RPA, and API integrations.
Develop human-in-the-loop systems and feedback loops to keep outputs accurate, relevant, and valuable over time.
Partner with business teams to understand their processes and pain points, ensuring every solution drives measurable improvement.
Define and track KPIs for your AI products, taking ownership from concept to deployment.
Upskill and educate others by running workshops and training sessions that make AI accessible across the organisation.
Champion responsible and ethical AI, embedding governance, fairness, and data privacy principles into every project.
What You’ll Bring
2 to 4 years of experience in AI, data science, or machine learning, with a proven ability to deliver real-world AI applications.
Strong technical skills in Python and SQL, plus hands-on experience deploying LLMs and RAG solutions.
Deep understanding of the trade-offs between different LLMs (cost, performance, accuracy) and how to select the right model for each use case.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex AI concepts into plain language.
Experience engaging stakeholders and driving adoption across both technical and non-technical teams.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and API-based deployments.
Knowledge of ethical AI, governance, and risk mitigation frameworks.
Exposure to MLOps practices, LangChain, or BI tools is a plus.
Why You’ll Love It Here
Purpose-driven work: Everything you build delivers real impact.
Curiosity and growth: You’ll have the space to experiment, learn, and innovate.
Collaboration and ownership: Be part of a team that supports each other and celebrates success together.
Inclusive culture: Bring your whole self to work and be valued for your perspective and expertise.

Advanced Navigation - It's In The Name

Advanced Navigation is a global leader in APNT and autonomous system technologies. By leveraging capabilities in software-defined hardware, every solution delivers unrivaled capabilities and exceptional performance across land, air, sea and space applications where GPS is unreliable. 

Made possible with extensive research, testing and vertically integrated manufacturing, the company has progressed into deep technology fields, including robotics, inertial, photonic and quantum sensing, artificial intelligence, underwater acoustics, and GPS antennas and receivers. Customers choose Advanced Navigation for rapid product delivery and unmatched technical field expertise.

Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, with research and production facilities nationwide and offices globally. Backed by KKR, In-Q-Tel (IQT), former Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull and  General David H. Petraeus (US Army, Ret.), Advanced Navigation supports AUKUS by collaborating with UK and US partners to drive innovation, fortify supply chains, and enhance allied resilience and interoperability in defense. #JoinTheAutonomyRevolution

About the role

We are seeking a visionary technical leader to join our engineering team as the Head of Algorithm Engineering. This is a pivotal role responsible for defining and executing the technical strategy for our core navigation algorithms and autonomy software. You will be the chief technical architect for these systems, leading a dedicated team of specialists to push the boundaries of performance and capability. The ideal candidate is a hands-on leader with extensive experience in architecting complex software solutions and a proven track record of leveraging AI and machine learning to solve real-world navigation challenges.

What you'll do

Technical Leadership & Architecture: Serve as the ultimate technical authority for all navigation and autonomy software. Design, architect, and oversee the development of robust, scalable, and high-performance algorithms.
AI & ML Implementation: Drive the strategy and implementation of AI and machine learning techniques to enhance our navigation solutions, from the research and development phase through to product deployment.
Team Leadership & Mentoring: Lead, manage, and mentor a high-calibre team of software and algorithm engineers. Foster a culture of innovation, technical excellence, and continuous improvement.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with hardware, firmware, and systems engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance across our entire product range, from low-cost to high-end systems.
Roadmap & Strategy: Collaborate with product and executive teams to define the long-term technical roadmap for our core software IP, ensuring it aligns with our strategic goals and market leadership in performance and time to market.
Quality & Performance: Establish best practices for software development, testing, and validation to ensure our solutions meet the rigorous demands of our global customers in markets like North America, Europe, and Asia and compliant with company policies and relevant software standards.

Ideal Candidate Profile and Past Experience

10+ years of experience in software development with at least 5 years in a senior leadership or technical architect role focused on navigation, robotics, or autonomous systems.
Deep expertise in estimation theory, sensor fusion, SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), VIO (Visual-Inertial Odometry), and control systems.
Proven experience in applying AI and machine learning principles to navigation and autonomy challenges in a commercial or defence environment.
Demonstrated experience leading and mentoring high-performing engineering teams.
Exceptional ability to architect complex, real-time software systems.
Australian citizens are desirable for security reasons, ADF experience is highly regarded and Veterans are encouraged to apply 
Advanced degree (Master's or PhD) in Computer Science, Robotics, Aerospace Engineering, or a related technical field.
Any experience within the defence, aerospace, or autonomous vehicle industries is highly desirable.
Familiarity with hardware-software integration and developing for embedded systems, a strong portfolio of relevant projects, publications, or patents and experience working in a high-growth, venture-backed technology company is beneficial but not essential.

Our Company

Daikin has a solid history and reputation in holding its number 1 position in the global market for air conditioning.  The foundation of its success and continued growth is truly in our people, who strive and are encouraged to do remarkable things, including thinking differently and being open to new possibilities. 

At Daikin Australia, we live and breathe our core values of Absolute Credibility, Enterprise Management and Building Harmonious Personal Relationships. We prioritise fostering positive relationships with clients, colleagues and stakeholders to create a collaborative and supportive work environment for all.

Looking ahead, we anticipate the global demand for air conditioning will grow exponentially. Our vision at Daikin after reaching our 100th anniversary globally, is to continue our commitment to environmental awareness and commit to advancing technology to promote sustainable practices.

 

About the Role

Join our Research & Development team as a Research & Technology Engineer, reporting to the Research & Technology Manager. The purpose of this role is to promote technology innovation and early deployment of new technology into Daikin products, and to explore DAS residential solution opportunities.




Key Responsibilities

New Technology and Solution Development:

Conducting air conditioner stable and dynamic simulation, control logic optimization, and zone controller system integration, actively simulating refrigerant side, air side, and electrical side components.

Developing simulation methods/tools for product development Proof of Concept (PoC) study and control logic verification.

Building load forecast and energy usage strategy simulation and verification, including building energy modelling and global optimization strategy based on data acquisition and integration with other appliances.

Verifying and improving simulation accuracy, reducing NPD testing time/iterations, and automating testing result analysis.

Performing data analysis, failure prediction, comfort analysis, and customer claim analysis based on data and simulation.

 

Product Development Support:

Teaching and leading simulation tasks across product development teams and supporting technical decision-making with simulation verification.

Applying engineering knowledge and experience to improve the process to design air conditioner systems and supporting the digitisation of the new product development process.

Contributing to internal best practices and workflow methodologies to improve accuracy, reduce errors, and enhance knowledge transfer.

Seeds development and simulation verification for new product ideas.




About You

We're looking for a highly skilled and motivated individual with:

Mandatory Qualifications & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree or above in heat transfer, air conditioning, or similar.

2+ years of relevant industry experience or fluid dynamics or thermal engineering–based post-graduate studies.

Full working rights in Australia (permanent resident or citizenship).




Key Technical Competencies:

Good understanding of air conditioning components designs and selection.

Experience with CFD (e.g., Star-CCM+, fluent, or similar).

Experience with 3D modelling tools (e.g., Solidworks, ProE, NX, or similar).

Experience with air conditioning simulation platforms (e.g., Dymola, Matlab/Simulink, Modelica, or similar).

Experience with programming languages such as C, C#, VBA, or Python.




Preferable Technical Competencies:

Understanding of wind tunnel testing, air conditioner performance testing, and/or real-world measurements.

Understanding of electrical system or control diagrams.

Understanding of Australia Standards such as MEPS/NCC, and building rating systems.




Behavioural Competencies:

Self-driven & Enthusiastic: Eager to learn and passionate about solving technical challenges.

Innovative: A diversified thinker who is keen to contribute to R&D and new technology.

Attention to detail: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in all tasks.

Adaptable: Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-performance setting, willing to adapt to new tools and methodologies as needed.

Strong communication skills, particularly good communication with non-technical peers.

Good team player: Thrives in a collaborative and supportive environment.




Why join us?

Collaborative work environment fostering a positive team culture.

Competitive Salary + Superannuation + Performance bonus

Provided with on-the-job training for continuous career growth opportunities

Discounted Bupa Health Fund

Flare Benefit – Discounted gift card, novated lease, discounted health/car/home loan

Be part of a global number 1 company in HVAC

Be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration and personal growth.

Free parking on site

Apply today to join a company that values its employees and offers a great work environment!

About JL2 Defence Services

JL2 Defence Services (JL2) is a wholly Australian owned professional services company with roots in the ACT, NSW and QLD. JL2 specialises in the delivery of Organisational Change, Program Management, Enterprise Architecture consultancy services, as well as services in systems engineering, ICT consulting, project management, government acquisition management and aviation maintenance services. The JL2 team of professionals work primarily across federal government and Defence organisations.

The JL2 team is recruited from highly motivated and experienced individuals who possess the necessary skills to work closely with our customers to deliver tangible organizational capability. Our team is made up of veterans as well as industry experienced professionals who pride themselves in the delivery of quality outcomes as we work without customers to understand and deliver on their key drivers.

As a successful candidate, you may work directly to the JL2 Project Managers or as sole representative within customer project teams undertaking consulting services in a systems engineering role.

A Systems engineer plays a lead role in the success of JL2 and client organisations undertaking change.

Purpose

This role lays the foundation or blueprint for programs, projects or systems from conception through production and into realisation. Aligned with the strategic objectives of Australia’s Guided Weapons and Explosive Ordnance (GWEO) Enterprise—which aims to establish sovereign Defence manufacturing capabilities and secure supply chains—the Systems Engineer will contribute to delivering complex Defence systems domestically. As a technical and business expert this role is concerned with the big picture of a project, in addition to details including cost, schedules, and any workability issues. The Systems Engineer will be a natural collaborator and will be required interact with senior client representatives, program managers and the engineering/development team at every turn, taking the lead in facilitating the achievement of a successful system.

This role lays the foundation or blueprint for programs, projects or systems from conception through production and into realisation. As a technical and business expert this role is concerned with the big picture of a project, in addition to details including cost, schedules, and any workability issues. The Systems Engineer will be a natural collaborator and will be required interact with senior client representatives, program managers and the engineering/development team at every turn, taking the lead in facilitating the achievement of a successful system.

Responsibilities may include

Definition and maintenance of system requirements.

Development of architectures (logical, reference, business, information and technical) and associated artefacts.

Development of specific technical solutions to various client requirements or the resolution of technical issues.

Definition and development of architecture frameworks, statements of applicability, or System Engineering Management Plans (SEMP).

Co-ordination and execution of design authority forums.

Review and analysis of technical documentation and specifications.

Development of future technology views.

Development of white papers, technical business cases and gap analysis artefacts.

Oversight and guidance to development of implementation teams.

Technical support and guidance to project and program managers. Engage with upper management regularly with reports on project status, activities, and achievements.

Skills and Abilities

Extensive and demonstrated experience with Defence systems or closely related background with strong IS/ICT domain knowledge

Demonstrated experience in delivering outcomes in large Defence acquisition & sustainment environments

Proven ability to meet project milestones

A demonstrable record in working within professional teams

Demonstrated experience in the integration and implementation of complex Defence systems across program and project boundaries

Experience in application design and integration, cloud computing, Defence related systems MOTS, GOTS

Demonstrated experience with various methods and notations such as, UML, BPMN, Gane & Sarson, Agile, Rational.

Sound understanding and experience with contemporary networking and security technology, patterns, practices and implementations.

It is highly desirable for candidates to have experience with the F-35 program.

Personal Attributes

Excellent written and oral communication skills as well as IT literacy

Self motivation with the ability to work autonomously and remotely when required

Proven ability to develop and maintain professional relationships at the executive levels down to individual team members

Measurement of Success

Success for the job can be viewed if the following is achieved;

Positive feedback from the relevant JL2 management/supervisor.

Positive feedback from the JL2 clients through PIR’s or direct feedback.

Delivery of services, products and artefacts to time, budget and quality as per the Project Schedule and JL2 quality assurance processes.

JL2 Group has achieved it goals WRT customer satisfaction and sold margin/revenue, customer.

The professional growth and maturity of the Systems Engineering community within JL2

Security Requirements

MUST be an Australian citizen and have the ability to obtain and maintain a minimum Australian Government Security Vetting Agency clearance of Negative Vetting 1.

** This position description is not an exhaustive list of responsibilities and you will be expected to perform different tasks which fit with your skills, abilities and knowledge as may be necessitated by the changing business environment and the overall objectives of the organisation.

Ad Text:
About your role

As part of the Data & Analytics Service within Digital Advisory & Transformation, you'll lead the design, development, and delivery of advanced AI, machine learning, and analytics solutions.

You will:

Develop and deliver the MSH AI & Data Science roadmap aligned with digital health priorities.
Lead AI and ML initiatives from concept through to deployment and evaluation.
Build strong partnerships with clinicians, executives, researchers, and industry.
Drive innovation while ensuring responsible and ethical AI practices.
Lead, mentor, and grow a high-performing AI & Data Science team.
Represent MSH at state and national forums to advance digital health initiatives.

About you

You're a strategic thinker and hands-on leader with the ability to turn complex data challenges into actionable insights. 

You bring:

Proven expertise in AI/ML, data science, and advanced analytics.
Strong understanding of health data systems, interoperability, and cloud platforms (Azure/AWS).
Demonstrated ability to develop and implement AI strategy and roadmaps.
Experience leading multidisciplinary technical teams in data and analytics.
Relevant graduate degree or related qualification and/or combination of industry related experience.
Agile based certification and its applicability within an ICT or data led initiative (highly desirable)

What we can offer you:

We are renowned for teaching and research excellence with strong relations with Queensland's leading tertiary institutions.
We want to empower you to build a long-term career, with countless opportunities to learn and grow, no matter your role
You'll have all the benefits of working for Queensland's world-class public health system including generous leave entitlements, attractive salary and remuneration packages, salary packaging and access to relevant professional development allowances and/or leave, study and research assistance, corporate discounts and employee wellness programs.

Princess Alexandra Hospital:

The Princess Alexandra Hospital (PAH) is a tertiary health care centre providing care in most major adult specialties. We provide world class health care to Brisbane City's southern suburbs across emergency, medical, mental health and surgical services, including liver and kidney transplant.

We are nationally recognised for our expertise in trauma management and organ transplants and are one of Australia's leading academic and research health centres. The PAH as a major medical research precinct hosts Australia's most advanced medical research facility, the Translational Research Institute (TRI) as well as a new Clinical Research Facility for the discoveries made at TRI to be trialed in a safe clinical environment.

We're expanding our hospital to make sure everyone gets the care they need. We're adding more beds, modernising our buildings, and improving our spaces to treat kidney and cancer patients with all new services and facilities planned to open by 2027.

INTEGRITY | COMPASSION | ACCOUNTABILITY | RESPECT | ENGAGEMENT | EXCELLENCE

Our values were created by employees for employees to shape our culture and inspire positive interactions in the workplace. Diversity of ideas, skills, traditions, and customs is celebrated as one of our greatest strengths. Having a workforce that reflects and understands the needs and expectations of our community is important to delivering safe, kinder, and more inclusive care.

We recognise our strength comes from the diversity of our people and so we encourage people of all genders, ethnicities, ages, abilities, languages, sexual orientation, and family responsibilities to apply.

We are Metro South Health:

We are the major public healthcare provider for Brisbane's south side, Logan, Redlands, and the Scenic Rim operating five major hospitals and a range of community, specialty, and state-wide healthcare services.

We are bold, innovative, collaborative, inspiring. We save lives, change lives, and make the world a better place. We are part of and proud of the community we serve.

We are better together.

About Us

Andromeda Robotics is an ambitious social robotics company with offices in Melbourne and San Francisco, dedicated to creating robots that seamlessly and intelligently interact with the human world. Our first robot, Abi, is a testament to this vision—a custom-built platform designed from the ground up to be a helpful aid and intuitive partner in aged care homes. We are a passionate, collaborative team of engineers who solve some of the most challenging problems in AI and robotics. To accelerate our development and ensure Abi's reliability, we are seeking a foundational member to build out our capabilities to train and test our robot in simulation. 

Our Values

Deeply empathetic - Kindness and compassion are at the heart of everything we do.

Purposely playful - Play sharpens focus. It keeps us curious, fast and obsessed with the craft.

Relentlessly striving - With relentless ambition, an action bias and constant curiosity, we don’t settle.

Strong when it counts - Tenacious under pressure, we expect problems and stay in motion to adapt and progress.

United in action - Different minds. Shared mission. No passengers.

The Role

We are looking for a creative and driven Simulation and Test Engineer to build Andromeda's testing infrastructure for our conversational AI systems and embodied character behaviours. Your immediate focus will be creating robust test systems for Abi's voice-to-voice chatbot, social awareness perception, and gesture motor control. As this infrastructure matures, you'll extend it into simulation environments for generating synthetic training data for character animation and gesture models.

The Team

You'll work at the intersection of our character software, robotics, perception, conversational AI, controls, and audio engineering teams. We bring deep expertise from autonomous vehicles and robotics, including simulation backgrounds. You'll collaborate with product owners and technical specialists to define requirements, integrate systems, and ensure quality across our AI/ML stack.



Requirements

Phase 1: Build The Test Foundation
Define and stand up synthetic test environments for our AI/ML conversational stack
Conversational AI testing: voice-to-voice chat quality, response appropriateness, tool calling accuracy
Memory system testing: context retention, recall accuracy, conversation coherence
Audio modelling and testing: multi-speaker scenarios, room acoustics, voice activity detection
Perception system testing: social awareness (face detection, gaze tracking, person tracking)
Gesture appropriateness testing: Working with our Controls/ML team, create test infrastructure to validate that Abi's body gestures
CI/CD and automated regression testing for all AI/ML subsystems
Custodian of quality metrics: if they don't exist, work with stakeholders to elicit use cases, derive requirements, and establish measurable quality metrics
Requirements formalisation: you're skilled at gathering, documenting, and tracing requirements back to test cases
Phase 2: Scale To ML Training Infrastructure

Our approach to gesture generation requires high-fidelity synthetic interaction data at scale. You'll investigate and build the infrastructure to generate this data, working closely with our character software team to define requirements and validate approaches.

Extend test environments into training data generation pipelines
Investigate and stand up simulation tools (e.g. Unity, Unreal Engine, Isaac Sim) to support our machine learning pipeline with synthetic data and validation infrastructure
Build infrastructure for fine-tuning character animation models on simulated multi-actor scenarios
Enable ML-generated gesture development to augment hand-crafted animation workflows
Create virtual environments with diverse social interaction scenarios for training and evaluation
Success In This Role Looks Like

Months 1-3, stabilise our conversational system with automated regression tests and measurable quality benchmarks. By month 6, deliver an integrated simulation environment enabling rapid testing and iteration across our AI/ML stack.

You'll design tests that push our systems beyond their limits and find what's brittle. Through trade studies and make-vs-buy decisions, you'll establish the infrastructure, set up automatic regression tests, and trace test cases back to high-level requirements. You'll be the final guardian, verifying that our AI and machine learning systems work as intended before integration with Abi's physical platform. Your work will directly impact the speed and quality of our development, ensuring that every software build is robust, reliable, and safe.

Key Responsibilities
Architect and Build: Design, develop, and maintain scalable test infrastructure for conversational AI, perception, and gesture control systems
Own Testing Pipeline: Develop a robust CI/CD pipeline for automated regression testing, enabling rapid iteration and guaranteeing quality before deployment
Develop Test Scenarios: Create diverse audio environments, multi-actor social scenarios, and edge cases to rigorously test Abi's conversational and social capabilities
Model with Fidelity: Implement accurate models of Abi's hardware stack (cameras, microphone array, upper body motion) as needed for test and simulation scenarios
Enable Future ML Training: Design test infrastructure with an eye towards evolution into a simulation platform for generating synthetic training data for character animation and gesture models
Integrate and Collaborate: Work closely with the robotics, AI, and software teams to seamlessly integrate their stacks into the test infrastructure and define testing requirements
Analyse and Improve: Develop metrics, tools, and dashboards to analyse test data, identify bugs, track performance, and provide actionable feedback to the engineering teams
Ideally You Have
Bachelor or Masters in Computer Science, Robotics, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of professional experience testing complex AI/ML systems (conversational AI, perception systems, or embodied AI)
Strong programming proficiency in Python (essential); C++ experience valuable
Hands-on experience with LLM testing, voice AI systems, or chatbot evaluation frameworks
Understanding of audio processing, speech recognition, and/or computer vision fundamentals
Experience with testing frameworks and CI/CD tools (pytest, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.)
Familiarity with ML evaluation metrics and experimental design
A proactive, first-principles thinker who is excited by the prospect of owning a critical system at an early-stage startup
Bonus Points
Experience with simulation platforms (e.g. Unity, Unreal Engine, NVIDIA Isaac Sim, Gazebo) and physics engines
Experience with character animation systems, motion capture data, or gesture generation
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, imitation learning, or synthetic data generation for training ML models
Experience with 3D modelling tools and game engine content creation
Understanding of ROS2 for robotics integration
Knowledge of sensor modelling techniques for cameras and audio
Experience building and managing large-scale, cloud-based simulation infrastructure
PhD in a relevant field


Benefits



The salary for this position may vary depending on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package may also include additional benefits or components based on the specific role. Details will be provided if an employment offer is made.

Job Title: Lead Data Engineer – AWS / Big Data / Cloud Transformation
Ad Text:
Join a high-performing Data team that’s driving a large-scale transformation program within the banking and financial services industry. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious and technically strong Data Engineer to play a lead role in shaping a modern, cloud-based data platform.

You’ll be joining a collaborative, forward-thinking environment where innovation, problem-solving, and technology excellence are at the heart of everything they do.

What you’ll be doing As a Lead Data Engineer, you’ll take ownership of major data initiatives, leading a team to modernise and optimise core data pipelines and platforms. You’ll combine strategic thinking with hands-on expertise to deliver scalable, automated, and efficient data solutions leveraging cloud and big data technologies.

Key responsibilities
Lead the design and delivery of end-to-end data engineering solutions across key transformation programs.
Guide and mentor a team of engineers to build efficient, high-quality data pipelines and integrations.
Drive platform optimisation through automation and AI capabilities.
Collaborate with architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to align solutions with strategic data objectives.
What you’ll bring
Deep Big Data and Hadoop experience with strong Spark, Hive, and Presto (or equivalent) skills.
Expert-level SQL, including query tuning and optimisation.
Proven experience implementing ETL/ELT solutions using tools like Talend, DataStage, or Informatica.
Strong AWS experience across EC2, S3, RDS, and EMR.
Sound understanding of data modelling, metadata management, lineage, and data quality frameworks.
Hands-on Python experience, particularly in automation and AI integration.
Why apply You’ll be part of an organisation that values collaboration, innovation, and technical excellence. This is a key leadership opportunity for someone passionate about modern data engineering, automation, and cloud transformation within a leading financial institution.

We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 219,000+ people across 54 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.

The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be.

Are you ready to be an important part of this ever-transformational journey?
